Key Match Events: Ismaila Sarr scored a second-half penalty in the 71st minute to secure a 1-0 victory for Senegal.
Senegal's defense held firm to secure the win despite previous concerns after their last-minute equalizer against Burkina Faso.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Senegal claimed their first win in Group L of the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers.
The match was held at the Bingu National Stadium in Lilongwe, Malawi.
Burundi made a double change at the start of the second half to strengthen their team.
Senegal introduced Habib Diallo and Iliman Ndiaye just after the hour mark to boost their attack.
